sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Powdered Caffeine Control and Education Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Powdered Caffeine Control and Education Act.

sections.heading: Findings. The General Assembly finds that the United States Food and Drug Administration issued a warning concerning powdered pure caffeine that companies market to consumers
sections.text: The powder, often sold in bulk, is nearly 100% pure caffeine. Caffeine powder is easily purchased online, including on websi

sections.heading: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to ban the sale of powdered pure caffeine to minors within the State in order to protect their health and safety.
sections.text: Purpose. The purpose of this Act is to ban the sale of powdered pure caffeine to minors within the State in order to protect their health and safety.

sections.heading: Definitions.  As used in this Act:
sections.text: Definitions. As used in this Act:

sections.heading: Control of the sale of powdered pure caffeine.
sections.text: Control of the sale of powdered pure caffeine.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 1, 2016.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 1, 2016.
